judgment_text:
IN THE HIGH COURT OF JUDICATURE AT BOMBAY
O. O. C. J.
OFFICIAL LIQUIDATOR'S REPORT NO.94/07/ VI
IN
COMPANY PETITION NO.32 OF 1986
In   the   matter  of   M/s.   Raman  Engineering   Limited   (in
liqn.) through Official Liquidator, High Court, Bombay
....
Ms. Aakanksha Thakkar i/b Purnanand & Co. for SICOM.
Mr. P. Ramarao, Official Liquidator present.
....
CORAM: DR. D.Y. CHANDRACHUD, J.
 21st June, 2007.
P.C. :
The Official Liquidator has adjudicated upon the claims
of the workers and secured creditors. In the circumstances, prayer
clauses (a) and (b) are granted. Prayer clause ( c) which relates to
the dues of the Sales Tax Department and the Regional Provident
Fund Commissioner is also granted subject to the conditions spelt
out   therein.     Prayer   clause   (d)   is   also   granted.     The   Official
Liquidator   states   that   necessary   payments   in   terms   of   prayer
clause (a) shall be made within a period of two weeks from today.
